assessment.title: Are there any shops? (Unit 6, Lesson 2)
assessment.helpText:
Rearrange the words to form sentences. When you drag and drop a word onto another they swap places.
Click on Submit to submit your answers.

You will find out whether you got the answers right or wrong. If you get any answers wrong, click on Show answers to see the correct answers (you will not be able to change your answers, though).

Click on the ‘Next’ arrow to move to the next screen. You can check your score at any time by clicking on My score.

At the end of the test you will receive your score, and you will have the option of re-taking the test if you want to.

feedback.final: Do you want to try again?

assessmentItem.rubric: Put the words in the right place.

group.prompt: Are there any shops in your village?
Is there a mosque near here?
There is a big primary school.

assessmentItem.rubric: Put the words in the right place.

group.prompt: The garage is between two shops.
It is in the middle of London.
The primary school is on the left.
The garage is on the right.
There is a bank next to the shop.

assessmentItem.rubric: Put the words in the right place.

group.prompt: Has the village got a bank?
The hotel has got two restaurants.
My house has got two bedrooms.
The bathroom is on the right.
